paragraph.value: Finally, for the last setting, we tested the system using the three auto-annotation modes (i.e., FA, HFA, and UFA) as shown in Table 3. While the auto-annotation mode can allow us to reduce up to
% of the data pool, this drastic saving also reduces the accuracy of the learned model, achieving, on average, around

% F-Score. Overall, our framework presents a trade off between coverage and annotation cost. The HFA auto-annotation mode shows the benefit, especially in a realistic enterprise setting, when we need to annotate 33% of the data to increase F-Score by only
% (when comparing the on average performance of HFA with ESA) is unreasonable. Table 3 appears to show FA being
to EAL in terms of the percentage cut for the Location class, for example. In reality FA reduced sentence annotation by 65% to reach
F-Score. But as our testing criteria demanded that we either reach
